text:
This patch provides support for using a "start" tag and a "stop" tag as well 
(or instead of) dates.
It is similar to the CvsTagDiff task, except it uses 'log' rather than 'rlog' - 
and as such does not require a module name to be passed through.  This allows 
nested components to use the same task.  It relies on using the -r(start):
(stop) argument in the CVS command.
creator: andrew_s_craig@yahoo.com
andrew_s_craig@yahoo.com
text:
Created attachment 10748
Proposed patch to provide start/stop tag support.
This is a partial duplicate of Bug 27419
creator: rob@springwellfarms.ca
andrew_s_craig@yahoo.com
text:
It is, except that the patch provided in Bug 27419 seems to only allows tags to 
work in rlog mode, rather than the regular 'log' mode.  This patch allows you 
to use the same 'log' command (so that, for example, two nested sandboxes will 
log correctly).

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
tags are supported since 1.6.1 via the tag attribute inherited from <cvs>.

Maybe to explicit attributes are still better (given that this request occurs
multiple times in bugzilla).

Even though it is not strictly a duplicate, I'll mark it as such to have the
different reports in a single place.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 27419 ***
